result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Darnell Sloan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay all mandatory court costs, victim witness surcharge, DNA surcharge.  To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid by the end of Extended Supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.
Concurrent with: AS TO COUNTS THREE, FOUR, FIVE, SIX AND EIGHT, EACH COUNT:  Concurrent to each other, but consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for zero days. Sentence is exactly the same.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain full time employment or schooling.

No alcohol or contolled substances.
No contact with any drug users, dealers, places of drug activity.

Successfully complete a cognitive thinking behavioral modification program.
Obey all DOC rules.
Make monthly payments toward supervision fees.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment and aftercare.  Absolute sobriety.   Random urine screens and breathalyzers at least once monthly.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Concurrent with: AS STATED/SPECIFIED  ON COUNT THREE.
Concurrent with: AS STATED/SPECIFIED ON COUNT THREE.
Concurrent with: AS STATED/ SPECIFIED ON COUNT THREE.

Concurrent with: AS STATED/ SPECIFIED ON COUNT THREE.
**Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program after serving five (5) years of this sentence.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order as been electronically sent to DOC. DJ

Filed, signed Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order.  
It is ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.
It is further ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 02, Judge Childs. DJ

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua Darnell Sloan in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Defendant Joshua Darnell Sloan in custody.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

The sentences for COUNTS 3, 4, 5, 6 and 8 are exactly the same and are concurrent to each other but consecutuve to any other sentence.

  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements by:Michael S.

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 12 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 7 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS, each count is concurrent to each other but consecutive to any other sentence, credit for zero days.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program AFTER serving 5 years of this sentence  and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Pay all mandatory Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by the end of extended supervision ; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by the end of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment and after care
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers at least once monthly
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Maintain full time employment or schooling
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-No contact with any druger users/dealers/places of drug activity
-Obey all DOC rules
-Make monthly payments toward supervision fees
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Certification of transcript of proceedings of SCHEDULING CONFERENCE commencing 05/28/2014 received and filed. (8 Pages.)
Original Transcript in 14CF1597. Copy of transcript forwarded to Mr. Richard L. Zaffiro, 4261 N. 92nd St., Wauwatosa, WI 53222-1617.
Documents for sentencing, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Joshua Darnell Sloan in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Defendant Joshua Darnell Sloan in custody.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

AS TO COUNT 7:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered COUNT 7 dismissed, and read in.

AS TO COUNTS 3, 4, 5, 6, AND 8:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered PENALTY ENHANCERS DISMISSED.

AS TO COUNTS 3, 4, 5, 6, AND 8:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 5/18/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.
